values: If being "nice" means pretending to like everybody and everything they do, but then talking about them behind their backs.. Well then I'll just take my chances being real.
These words are amazing I can't believe how deeply this captures how I feel

The 50 Things Moms Miss Most About Their Pre-Kid Lives

http://www.scarymommy.com/things-moms-miss-most-about-their-pre-kid-lives/

Yes. YES. YEEESSSSS!!!!

Dear Diary,

I have changed so much, you'd hardly recognize me. I am no longer shackled by anxiety, drained by dark depression.. Since being blessed with children of my own, I have grown into this new person - a stronger version of myself.

So now when I feel trapped and hopeless it is because the I am dealing with the consequences of the decisions I have made for myself, all these years, under the pressure of debilitating anxiety.

I am thirty years old now, and only just discovering my own personal interests in life. I've taken up a sport that I participate in with other women and girls. I want to be good; I want to compete!

In my free time I study course material with the goal of one day earning a diploma or certificate that could lead me to a career. Now when I study my head is clear, I am focused. So completely different from the girl I had been fresh out of high school, terrified - of the world, of becoming a failure - driven by fear. My mind was so constantly overwhelmed by onslaughts of anxious thoughts it was a wonder I did manage to walk away from university several years later with a degree.

I met my husband during high school and we have been together ever since. I see now that we both needed each other in a way that could only be described as codependency. Everything we do, every decision we make, we do it together. As a result, I am now at home 24/7 with our two children, while my husband works from home. My days are long and consist primarily of me running around making sure I spend quality time with all three individuals who need my attention dearly. I sleep hard, I take naps; all I think about is sleep and when I can get more of it. It never takes me longer than 30 seconds to fall asleep - I even doze off when I didn't intend to!

As a result of all this, I have become distant from everyone else in my life. I don't have friends or socialize anymore because it upsets the balance of our home life, of everyone so heavily dependent on me, and because I am always so incredibly tired. I feel horribly stuck in this life I have made for myself.

I don't know what I want out of my life anymore. To be honest, I don't see my husband the same way as I did before. I look at him now like his is just another one of my temperamental kids, whereas he still feels such passion for me as when we first started dating. I wonder whether I have lost my libido, if there's something wrong with my wiring.. But what if he's just doing it for me anymore?? :/

So I've decided to start writing in this 'anon' blog to sort out my thoughts and maybe garner some feedback about all of this and where I am going in my life. Because I'm not content with the way things are, but despite the fact that I have so obviously changed/grown as a person, I also clearly hate change.
